issue.title: Collision Handling slows the game down immensely
issue.body:
This is most likely due to the fact that we had the game checking collisions at every frame even if it is unlikely that there will be a collision happening.

Say there are **n** trees or other collidable objects on the screen. The current collision checking algorithm has to check the disc with every single object for a collision at every frame of the game. This should essentially be O(n) in terms of total numbers of checks per frame, but the calculations require library functions such as **math.sqrt** and also must check the global variable **disc** location.

The global reference problem can be solved by storing the players location per frame and then checking a collision at that time. I may create another issue involving fixing lots of unnecessary global references at a later date.

The collision handling issue can most likely be solved by using some sort of simplified quadtree or other algorithm that will help the collision handler check **only** objects that are within some given pixel distance from the disc.
